list-item.p: an increase in air temperature of 1°C–3°C over the next three to five decades
an expected increase in evapotranspiration by 5% – 15% by 2050 in Southern Africa, with concerns for available water resources in the country
challenges for agricultural production in both the summer and winter rainfall areas by mid-century, with particular concern for the maintenance of rural livelihoods

changes in the territorial range and prevalence of a variety of vector-borne diseases such as malaria and schistosomiasis (bilharzia), as well as a potential increase in the spread of food- and water-borne diseases
an increase in the frequency and intensity of extreme weather events such as flooding and wild fire, with heightened requirements for effective disaster management. (IPCC 2007b; Midgley et al. 2007)
